title: Footsteps Of Fate
opening: The apprentice tactician Mark and the young swordfighter Lyn. A strange pair on an even stranger journey. To prepare for the long road ahead, they go to Bulgar, the commercial center of Sacae. Unbeknownst to Lyn, she will discover something that will alter her life forever.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Mark! Over here! This is Bulgar, the biggest city in all of Sacae. We should purchase supplies for our journey.
Oh, my heart! What a dazzling vision of loveliness!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Wait, O beauteous one! Would you not favour me with your name? Or better yet, your company?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Where are you from, sir knight, that you speak so freely to a stranger?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Ha! I thought you’d never ask. I am from Lycia. I hail from the Caelin canton, home to men of passion and fire!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Shouldn’t that be home to callow oafs with loose tongues?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Ooooh... You’re even lovely when you’re cruel.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Let’s go, Mark. I‘ve nothing more to say.

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Wait! Please...

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Sain! Hold your tongue!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Ah, Kent! My boon companion! Why so severe an expression?

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: If your manner were more serious, I wouldn’t have to be so severe! We still have a mission to complete, Sain!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: I know that. But how could I remain silent in the presence of such beauty? It would have been discourteous!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: What do you know about courtesy!?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Excuse me! You’re blocking the road. If you would be so kind as to move your horses...

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Of course. My apologies...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Thank you. You, at least, seem honourable enough.

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Hm? Pardon me, but... I feel we’ve met before.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I beg your pardon?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Hey! No fair, Kent! I saw her first!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Tsk! It seems there are no decent men among Lycia’s knights! Let’s go, Mark! I’ve run out of patience!

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: Wait, please! It’s not like that! ...... Sain, you lout!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Huh? Not like that? I thought you were...

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: I am NOT you!!! Come, we must follow her! I suspect she might be—

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Be what? She’s our mission? You’re joking! Wait!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Run!!! We’re being pursued! Could it be those knights from town? No... It’s not them. These men are out for blood!

intro.speaker: Zugu
intro.line: Heh heh hehhh... Aren’t you the pretty one! Your name is Lyndis, is it not?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What did you call me? ...Who are you?

intro.speaker: Zugu
intro.line: Such a waste. An absolute waste. The things I’d do for gold... Ah, well. Time to die, darlin’! C’mon out, boys!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Oh no! There are more than I can handle... But I’ll not give up!
Hey! There she is!

intro.speaker: Zugu
intro.line: Huh?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Whew... Finally caught up... Hold! You there! What is your business? Such numbers against a girl? Cowards, every one of you!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: You! You’re from—

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: We can discuss that later. It appears these ruffians mean to do you harm. If it’s a fight they want, let them look to me!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Stand back! I’ll take care of this!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: No! This is my fight! Stay out of my way!

intro.speaker: Sain
intro.line: Well, I can’t just stand here and do nothing...

intro.speaker: Kent
intro.line: I have a solution. You there, command us. I am Kent, a knight of Lycia. My companion is Sain. We will follow your orders in this battle. Is that acceptable, milady?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Yes, it is. Mark and I will lead! Let’s go!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Blue units are allies. Direct them on the field as you did with Lyn before. Be warned: if Lyn is defeated, your journey is over, as is your game. If other blue units are beaten, the game will continue, but fallen companions will be unable to return to battle for the rest of the tutorial. Use caution and good judgement. After all blue units have been moved, it automatically becomes the enemy's turn. To begin with, select Sain. Place the cursor on Sain, and press the A Button.

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Attack! Move me to a space next to my foe!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Move me up next to the enemy!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Whoa! I missed!?

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Sain! Why aren't you using your sword?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: The lance is more heroic. A knight should look heroic, don't you think?

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: You're hopeless. If you don't take fighting more seriously, you're going to find yourself on the end of a blade!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Truth be told, I...forgot to buy a sword.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Forgot? Or were you simply too busy dallying with the ladies?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Don't be so mad! I'll be fine with a lance. I'm that good!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: I'd prefer to rely on your skill, not your empty bragging! Take my spare blade and use it to attack next time!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Are you sure? My thanks Kent!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: You're almost more trouble than you're worth. Almost.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Tactician! Allow me to make up for my companion's blunder. I am at your command!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Weapons possess a unique hierarchy. Swords best axes. Axes best lances. Lances best swords. This is called the weapon triangle. Remembering this is of the utmost importance. First, let's illustrate that swords are strong against axes. Select Kent.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Command me to attack!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: The enemy wields an axe. Use a sword for my attack!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: He’s almost defeated. Now, let’s deliver the final blow!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: I must be next to the enemy!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: I want to fight! I must be closer to my foe!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Tactician! Give me another chance!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: I failed you once before, but give me another chance... I'll not fail you again!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Move next to the enemy and attack!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Axe-wielding foes should be met with swords. Brandish your blade!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Gah!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Sain! Are you all right?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Yes. Yes, I am. I was able to dodge in time. I can't believe he evaded my sword stroke so easily. This is no jest.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Look closely. The enemy is hidden in the woods. The branches make it difficult to attack, don't they?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: You're right. I was so focused on attacking... I didn't see.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Your lack of attention may someday cost you your life!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Fine! I understand already! Let it go, Kent!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: If you truly understand, then act like it!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Kent worries too much. ...He's going to grow old before his time.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Each type of terrain has unique characteristics. For example, look at woods and plains. Battle an enemy from the woods, and the enemy will probably miss you. However, your attacks will be unimpeded, giving you a distinct advantage. The same is true for foes. If an enemy is in the woods, he is more difficult to hit. Factoring in your terrain benefits and the weapon triangle is vital in combat. The window at the bottom of the screen gives information on the terrain the cursor is placed on. Check to see what terrain type is advantageous by using the cursor. Now, let's put this to the test. Select Kent.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: I'm ready for battle. Command me as you will!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Move me next to the enemy.

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Let's use my sword to attack!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: It seems like a wise decision to leave that bandit to the knights.

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: For my part, if I'm going to take care of the other foe, I'll need to close the distance between us. The knight said that woods are advantageous, right? In that case...

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: That looks good. Let's move there, Tactician!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: You... Your name is Sain, right?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Yes! Sain the gallant of Caelin. That's me!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: If you insist... Why have you not healed yourself?

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Huh? Hey! I've been injured? What a cad I am! To wrinkle that perfect brow of yours with worry for me...

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Uh... I was thinking of giving you a vulnerary, but... It looks like you're fine. So, never you mind.

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: No, wait! I'll take it! Please! I'll take it!!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: To give away an item, use the trade command. Trade can only be used by units that are adjacent to one another. Let's use the trade command right now. Select Sain and move him next to Lyn.

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: I must use the vulnerary and put my lady's mind at ease! Tactician! Bring me to her!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: I mustn't worry my lady any longer. Come, Tactician! Direct me to her!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: I can't keep such a generous offer waiting! The healing power of love awaits with yon angel! Tactician! Tarry no longer!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Move me next to her! I implore you!

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Now select the trade command. Sain's and Lyn's possessions will be displayed together Use the cursor to select a vulnerary from Lyn's items, and give it to Sain. After you finished your trade, press the B Button to end the process. The B Button is the cancel button. It can be used to rescind mistaken commands and other things.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Place the cursor on Lyn's items. Press right on the + Control Pad.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Press up or down on the + Control Pad, and select a vulnerary. Then, press the A Button.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Press the A Button to accept the vulnerary from Lyn.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Press the B Button to stop trading.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Sain can now use Lyn's vulnerary. Select the vulnerary from the items and use it.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Furthermore, mounted units have the unique ability to move again. Essentially, this allows cavalry to move the number of spaces left in their movement range if they haven't done so already. However, the attack command, among others, nullifies the move again ability, so be careful. Select Sain and order him to move again.

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Ah, much better! Thanks, Tactician! And you have my gratitude as well, my angel!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Ah, much better! You have my gratitude, young ladies.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Mission goals change from chapter to chapter. This chapter's goal is to defeat all enemies. Check the chapter goals in the window to the upper right of the screen. To open the map menu, place the cursor on an unoccupied space and press the A Button. You can confirm the chapter goals here by choosing Status from the menu. The map menu also has the Suspend command. This is useful if you have to stop a chapter midway. Time to continue this chapter! Best of luck!

boss.speaker: Zugu
boss.line: Accursed knights, always tampering in others' affairs.

boss.speaker: Zugu
boss.line: Blast... There was only...supposed to be a lone...girl...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: That’s the last of them! Fantastic work, Mark!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: And now for these knights of Lycia. You were going to share your story with me?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Yes. We have ventured from Caelin, in Lycia, in search of someone.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Lycia... That’s the country beyond the mountains in the south-west, isn’t it?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Correct. We’ve come as messengers to the lady Madelyn, who eloped with a nomad some 19 years ago.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Madelyn?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Our lord the marquess of Caelin’s only daughter. He was heartbroken his own daughter would abandon him so. Eventually, the marquess simply declared that he had no daughter.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: And then, this year, we received a letter from Lady Madelyn. It said she, her husband, and their daughter were living happily on the Sacae plains. The marquess was ecstatic to learn he had a granddaughter of 18 years. I remember the smile on his face when he announced that he’d suddenly become a grandfather. The granddaughter’s name is Lyndis. This was also the name of the marquess’s wife, who passed away at an early age.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Lyndis?

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: That she should bear this name thawed the marquess’s heart. Now, his only wish is to meet his daughter’s family at least once. This is why we’re here. We didn’t know that Lady Madelyn died a few days after sending her letter... We only learnt this shortly after arriving here in Bulgar.

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: But we also learned all was not lost. Her daughter yet lives. We heard that she was living alone on the plains... I... I knew it immediately. You are the lady Lyndis.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Why would you think that...

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Your resemblance to your departed mother is remarkable.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What? Did you know my mother?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: I’m sorry to say that I never met her directly, but I saw her portraits in Castle Caelin.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: To the rest of my tribe, I was always Lyn. But when I was with my parents... When it was just the three of us, I was Lyndis. It’s all so strange. I was all alone in the world, and now I have a grandfather. Lyndis... I never thought I would hear that name again.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Wait! That bandit! He called me Lyndis, too!

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: What? How could he have–

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: He was a henchman of Lord Lundgren, wasn’t he?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Lundgren? Who’s that?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: He’s the marquess’s younger brother. Everyone assumed the lady Madelyn was gone forever. This made Lord Lundgren heir to the marquess’s title.

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: To be blunt, milady, your existence is an obstacle to your granduncle’s ambitions.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: That’s– But I have no interest in inheriting any title!

end.speaker: Sain
end.line: Unfortunately, your granduncle is not the sort of man to believe that. I believe the attempts on your life will persist.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What should I do?

end.speaker: Kent
end.line: Accompany us to Caelin. Continuing on this way is dangerous.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I feel I have little choice. I will go with you.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Mark... I’m sorry. This changes everything. What do you want me to do, Mark? You... want me to decide? Of course, your companionship would do much to ease my journey, but... It’s going to be so dangerous.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You’ll come? Are you sure? Thank you! Let me ask once again for your friendship and your aid.
